sentences.sContent: Smith outlasted his rivals in the council to become leader in 1996.
sentences.sCn: 史密斯比对手坚持得更久，于1996年成了委员会的领导人。

sentences.sContent: A leather sofa will usually outlast a cloth one.
sentences.sCn: 皮沙发一般要比布沙发耐用。

remMethod.val: out(超越) + last(坚持) → 比…持久

trans.tranOther: to continue to exist or be effective for a longer time than something else
